briefTitle: FS VH S/D 500 S-apr in Vascular Surgery
conditions: Hemostasis in Participants Receiving Peripheral Vascular Expanded Polytetrafluoroethylene (ePTFE) Graft Prostheses

armGroups.label: FS VH S/D 500 s-apr
interventionNames: Biological: Fibrin Sealant, Vapor Heated, Solvent/Detergent-treated with 500 IU/ml thrombin and synthetic aprotinin (FS VH S/D 500 s-apr)

armGroups.label: Manual compression with surgical gauze pads

interventions.name: Fibrin Sealant, Vapor Heated, Solvent/Detergent-treated with 500 IU/ml thrombin and synthetic aprotinin (FS VH S/D 500 s-apr)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

Preoperative inclusion criteria:

* Subjects undergoing vascular surgery (ie, conduit placement with an ePTFE graft), including arterio-arterial bypasses, including:

  * axillo-femoral
  * axillo-bifemoral
  * aorto-bifemoral
  * ilio-femoral
  * femoro-femoral
  * ilio-popliteal
  * femoro-popliteal (including below knee)
  * femoro-tibial vessel bypass
  * arterio-venous shunting for dialysis access in the upper or lower extremity
* Signed informed consent
* Subject is of childbearing potential, presents with a negative serum or urine pregnancy test, and agrees to employ adequate birth control measures for the duration of the study.
* Subject is willing and able to comply with the requirements of the protocol.

Intraoperative inclusion criterion:

* Suture line bleeding eligible for study treatment is present after surgical hemostasis (ie, suturing). (A definition of eligible suture line bleeding is provided in the study protocol.)

Exclusion Criteria:

Preoperative exclusion criteria:

* Other vascular procedures during the same surgical session (stenting and/or endarterectomy of the same artery are allowed)
* Congenital coagulation disorders
* Prior kidney transplantation
* Heparin-induced thrombocytopenia
* Known hypersensitivity to heparin
* Known hypersensitivity to aprotinin or other components of the product
* Known severe congenital or acquired immunodeficiency (eg, HIV infection or long-term treatment with immunosuppressive drugs (eg, organ transplantation patients)
* Prior radiation therapy to the operating field
* Severe local inflammation at the operating field
* Subject is pregnant or lactating at the time of enrollment
* Subject has participated in another clinical study involving an investigational product (IP) or investigational device within 30 days prior to enrollment or is scheduled to participate in another clinical study involving an IP or investigational device during the course of this study
* Subject has previously participated in this study (Protocol No.: 550801), ie, each subject can only be enrolled once.

Intraoperative Exclusion Criteria:

* Major intraoperative complications that require resuscitation or deviation from the planned surgical procedure
* Intraoperative change in planned surgical procedure, which results in subject no longer meeting preoperative inclusion and/or exclusion criteria, (eg, abandonment of ePTFE graft placement)

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved Hemostasis at 4 Minutes Post Treatment Application.
outcomeMeasures.description: Hemostasis at the study suture line must be maintained until closure of the surgical wound.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved Hemostasis at 6 Minutes Post Treatment Application
outcomeMeasures.description: Hemostasis at the study suture line must be maintained until closure of the surgical wound.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved Hemostasis at 10 Minutes Post Treatment Application
outcomeMeasures.description: Hemostasis at the study suture line must be maintained until closure of the surgical wound.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Participants With Intraoperative Rebleeding After Hemostasis at Study Suture Line
outcomeMeasures.description: Intraoperative rebleeding at the study suture line after occurrence of hemostasis.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Participants With Postoperative Rebleeding
Percentage of Participants With Graft Occlusion
outcomeMeasures.description: Determined clinically and defined as absence of blood flow through the graft.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Participants With Infection at the Surgical Site
Number of Participants With Infections by Grade
outcomeMeasures.description:
Infections were recorded according to:

* Grade I: only dermis affected
* Grade II: infection invades subcutaneous region but not the arterial implant
* Grade III: the arterial implant is infected

outcomeMeasures.title: Vital Signs: Systolic and Diastolic Blood Pressure (BP)- Preoperative Baseline
Percent Change in Vital Signs: Systolic and Diastolic Blood Pressure
outcomeMeasures.description: Percent Change in Systolic and Diastolic Blood Pressure (BP) Measured as: Preoperative Baseline - Intraoperative Day 0; Preoperative Baseline - Postoperative Day 1; and Preoperative Baseline - Postoperative Day 14

outcomeMeasures.title: Vital Signs: Heart Rate - Preoperative Baseline
Percent Change in Vital Signs: Heart Rate
outcomeMeasures.description: Percent Change in Heart Rate Measured as: Preoperative Baseline - Intraoperative Day 0; Preoperative Baseline - Postoperative Day 1; and Preoperative Baseline - Postoperative Day 14

outcomeMeasures.title: Vital Signs: Respiratory Rate - Preoperative Baseline
Percent Change in Vital Signs: Respiratory Rate
outcomeMeasures.description: Percent Change in Heart Rate Measured as: Preoperative Baseline - Postoperative Day 1; and Preoperative Baseline - Postoperative Day 14

outcomeMeasures.title: Laboratory Values Over Time: Hemoglobin
Laboratory Values Over Time: Hematocrit
Laboratory Values Over Time: Erythrocytes
Laboratory Values Over Time: Leukocytes, Basophils, Eosinophils, Lymphocytes, Neutrophils, and Monocytes
Laboratory Values Over Time: Platelets
Laboratory Values Over Time: Creatinine, Bilirubin, and Blood Urea Nitrogen (BUN)
Laboratory Values Over Time: Alanine Aminotransferase (ALT)
Laboratory Values Over Time: Aspartate Aminotransferase (AST)
Laboratory Values Over Time: Activated Partial Thromboplastin Time (aPTT)
Laboratory Values Over Time: International Normalized Ratio(INR)
Hemostasis at 4 Minutes After Treatment Application at the Suture Line by Bleeding Severity - Moderate Bleeding
outcomeMeasures.description:
Investigators were shown videos of bleeding severities to standardize assessments.

Moderate bleeding defined as:

* Either \>25% of the suture line bleeds, or
* ≥5 suture line bleedings were present, if counting of suture line bleedings was possible, or
* 1 pulsatile suture line bleeding was present.

outcomeMeasures.title: Hemostasis at 4 Minutes After Treatment Application at the Suture Line by Bleeding Severity - Severe Bleeding
outcomeMeasures.description:
Investigators were shown videos of bleeding severities to standardize assessments.

Severe bleeding defined as:

* Either \>50% of the suture line bleeds, or
* ≥10 suture line bleedings were present, if counting of suture line bleedings was possible, or
* \>1 pulsatile suture line bleeding was present, or
* ≥1 spurting suture line bleeding was present.
